p.d: During a student party in Tunis, 21 year-old Mariam is raped by police officers. Whether at the hospitals or the police stations, she will have to fight for her rights and her dignity to be respected. But how to obtain justice when it lies on the side of the tormentors? Directed by: Kaouther Ben Hania (Tunisia/France/Norway/Lebanon/Qatar/Switzerland, 2017) Freely adapted from "Coupable d'Avoir Été Violée" (Guilty of having been raped) by Meriem Ben Mohamed and Ava Djamshidi. Cast: Mariam Al Ferjani (Mariam), Ghanem Zrelli (Youssef), Noomane Hamda (Chedly), Mohamed Akkari (Lamjed), Chedly Arfaoui (Mounir), Anissa Daoud (Faiza), Mourad Gharsalli (Lassaad) Genre: drama Awards: Student Jury Prize (Angouleme 2017), official selection Un Certain Regard (Cannes 2017) Parental guidance: TV-PG
